intro: Tetraglochin acanthocarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded tetraglochin, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with a rough, serrated texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
